conclusion: Analyze the motion of the particle in both the electric field and the magnetic field.
Particle is launched horizontally with velocity v_0 and enters magnetic field at point P with angle 60 degrees relative to horizontal.
Vertical component of velocity at point P is v_y = v_0 * sqrt(3).
Vertical acceleration due to electric field is a_y = qE/m.
Time to reach point P is t = (v_0 * sqrt(3) * m) / (qE).
Horizontal distance traveled in time t is x = (v_0^2 * sqrt(3) * m) / (qE).
Distance from launch position to point P is (v_0^2 * sqrt(3) * m) / (qE).
